entry.def: If one thing is offset by another, the effect of the first thing is reduced by the second, so that any advantage or disadvantage is cancelled out.

example.ex: The increase in pay costs was more than offset by higher productivity...
example.tran: 提高的生产率抵消了增加的工资成本后仍有结余。

example.ex: The move is designed to help offset the shortfall in world oil supplies caused by the UN embargo.
example.tran: 此举旨在缓解联合国禁运所造成的世界石油供应短缺的局面。
